name: " Ask The Cards " Handmade Leather Tarot Card Case
description:
*EACH CASE IS HANDMADE TO ORDER*

As a Lover of the Tarot, I created this custom case to hold a standard "Rider-Waite" Tarot card deck. It can however, hold many different sized decks.
Case measures:
3 1/8 wide by 5 1/2 inches long by 1 1/8 deep.
If you choose to leave your cards boxed, the original Rider deck box fits right inside this leather case, or you can do as I've done and wrap your cards in a small silk scarf and place inside.

Case is 100% leather and is two pieces riveted together, with an antique brass- hooking clasp. Leather is stained in an antique wash. Gold or silver hardware available. Please leave your preferance in the message to seller box at checkout. I can also customize colors upon request, or cut slits in the back if you would like to loop this over an existing costume belt etc..

This listing is for ONE tarot card case only. Tarot deck and scarf not included. Thank you!

name: The Muse...Hand Tooled Leather F-Holes Violin Belt
description:
This beautiful design was inspired by the F-Holes or "cuts" found on the violin. It is also very popular in the tattoo culture for women to have these done on their back or stomach to look as if their body was a beautiful classic instrument. Now you can wear it as a belt!

*THIS BELT IS CUSTOM MADE TO ORDER *
~ to fit your waist size so please include this in your message to seller when ordering.

It is all handcut, hand tooled, stained by yours truly. Colored in a rich mahogany with a black wash to look like woodgrain. The belt is widest at center at 5 inches and tapers out to 1 1/4 at buckle back. lovely brass tone buckle and 7 holes for adjusting up or down an inch from your true waist measurement. The back/underside is sealed black unlined leather. (SAMPLE PIC SHOWS 3 BUT WILL IN FACT HAVE 7)

Please allow 3 weeks from payment for construction and delivery.
Ships priority within the USA. First class international.
Any questions/concerns please convo before ordering, Thanks!
